messages.content: can you tell me how mant reverse split the stock DSS has done so far?

DSS, Inc. (DSS) has undergone four reverse stock splits. The reverse splits occurred on November 1, 2001 (1 for 200) [companiesmarketcap](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [divvydiary](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1], August 26, 2016 (1 for 4) [splithistory](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2], May 8, 2020 (1 for 30) [splithistory](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2) [divvydiary](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1], and January 5, 2024 (1 for 20) [splithistory](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2) [companiesmarketcap](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [divvydiary](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1]. There was also a forward stock split on April 27, 2023 (1077 for 1000) [splithistory](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2).

web_research_result:
DSS, Inc. (DSS) has undergone multiple stock splits throughout its history. Here's a summary of the documented splits:

*   **November 1, 2001:** A 1 for 200 reverse split [companiesmarketcap](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [divvydiary](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1).
*   **August 26, 2016:** A 1 for 4 reverse split [splithistory](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2). For every 4 shares owned pre-split, the shareholder received 1 share [splithistory](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2). For example, a 1000 share position pre-split, became a 250 share position following the split [splithistory](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2).
*   **May 8, 2020:** A 1 for 30 reverse split [splithistory](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2) [divvydiary](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1). For every 30 shares owned pre-split, the shareholder received 1 share [splithistory](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2). For example, a 250 share position pre-split, became approximately 8.33 shares [splithistory](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2).
*   **April 27, 2023:** A 1077 for 1000 split [splithistory](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2). For every 1000 shares owned pre-split, the shareholder now owned 1077 shares [splithistory](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2). For example, approximately 8.33 shares pre-split, became 8.975 shares after the split [splithistory](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2).
*   **January 5, 2024:** A 1 for 20 reverse split [splithistory](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2) [companiesmarketcap](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-0) [divvydiary](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-1). For every 20 shares owned pre-split, the shareholder received 1 share [splithistory](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2). For example, approximately 8.975 shares pre-split, became 0.44875 shares following the split [splithistory](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-2). This reverse split was announced on December 22, 2023, and was part of a compliance plan with the NYSE American [nasdaq](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-3). The reverse split reduced the number of shares of common stock issued and outstanding from approximately 140 million to approximately 7 million [edgar-online](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-4).

It's important to note that reverse stock splits are often used by companies to increase their stock price, potentially to maintain listing requirements or attract investors [finra](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5). However, they can also be associated with low-priced, high-risk stocks, so caution is advised when a company announces a reverse split [finra](https://vertexaisearch.cloud.google.com/id/0-5).
